programs.name: FEMA Hazard Mitigation Grant Program (HMGP) - Safe Room Funding
programs.outcome: Has funded thousands of residential and community safe rooms; exact numbers vary by state and year. Oklahoma alone has received substantial funding for safe room construction post-tornado events.

programs.name: Oklahoma Safe Room Rebate Program
programs.outcome: State and local programs have provided rebates/grants for residential safe room construction; Moore, OK and other tornado-prone communities have installed thousands of residential safe rooms

programs.name: FEMA Pre-Disaster Mitigation (PDM) Grant Program
programs.outcome: Funds community safe rooms in schools, community centers, and manufactured housing parks in tornado-prone regions

statistics.claim: FEMA estimates that safe rooms built to ICC 500/FEMA P-361 standards provide near-absolute protection from tornado winds up to EF5 intensity (250+ mph)
statistics.source: FEMA P-361 Safe Rooms for Tornadoes and Hurricanes

statistics.claim: The United States averages approximately 1,200 tornadoes per year, with significant casualties in years with major outbreaks
Mobile homes account for a disproportionate share of tornado fatalities despite being a smaller percentage of housing stock
statistics.source: NOAA/National Weather Service tornado fatality statistics

studies.title: FEMA P-361: Safe Rooms for Tornadoes and Hurricanes - Guidance for Community and Residential Safe Rooms
studies.finding: Establishes engineering standards for safe room construction that can withstand EF5 tornado winds and hurricane-force winds; provides design specifications for residential and community shelters

studies.title: ICC 500: ICC/NSSA Standard for the Design and Construction of Storm Shelters
studies.finding: National consensus standard for storm shelter design, construction, and performance criteria

studies.authors: National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST)
studies.title: Technical Investigation of the May 22, 2011 Tornado in Joplin, Missouri
studies.finding: Investigation of the Joplin tornado (EF5, 158 deaths) recommended improved building codes and wider adoption of safe rooms, particularly in schools and critical facilities

examples.description: After devastating EF5 tornadoes in 1999, 2003, and 2013, Moore implemented aggressive safe room programs. Thousands of residential safe rooms have been installed with FEMA and local funding. The 2013 tornado prompted additional investment in school safe rooms.
examples.source: City of Moore Emergency Management; FEMA case studies

examples.description: Following the 2011 EF5 tornado, Joplin rebuilt with enhanced shelter requirements including safe rooms in new school construction and community shelter programs
examples.source: NIST Joplin Tornado Investigation; local government recovery plans

examples.description: Alabama has implemented safe room programs following multiple deadly tornado outbreaks, including community safe rooms in manufactured housing communities where residents are most vulnerable

notes: IMPORTANT CAVEAT: I was unable to perform live web searches to verify current statistics and find the most recent data.
